definitions.definition: A demand of ownership made for something.
The right or ground of demanding.
examples: You don't have any claim on my time, since I'm no longer your employee.

definitions.definition: A new statement of something one believes to be the truth, usually when the statement has yet to be verified or without valid evidence provided.
examples: The company's share price dropped amid claims of accounting fraud.

definitions.definition: A demand of ownership for previously unowned land.
examples: Miners had to stake their claims during the gold rush.

definitions.definition: A legal demand for compensation or damages .

main_definition: A demand of ownership made for something.
secondary_definitions: The right or ground of demanding.
A new statement of something one believes to be the truth, usually when the statement has yet to be verified or without valid evidence provided.
A demand of ownership for previously unowned land.
( law ) A legal demand for compensation or damages .
